title: On Ice

children.value:
A rock is resting on a horizontal sheet of ice and acted on by two forces of magnitudes 
$\quantity{15}{N}$
 and 
$\quantity{20}{N}$
, in perpendicular directions North and East respectively. The friction between the rock and the ice is negligible.
Find the direction in which it moves with respect to North.
What is the mass of the rock?

The forces continue to act so that the rock moves in a straight line for 
$\quantity{6.0}{s}$
.
Calculate the velocity acquired by the rock in this time.
Calculate also the distance it has travelled.
